page.title: 09TONMAWR - RELIGION
page.content: The{Church in Wales}is represented by a vicar whose parish is split between Tonmawr and Pontrhydyfen, a neighbouring village. The church itself is located in what used to be the old school house, before the present school was built. Nonconformist religious needs are met by{The Mission}which is run by its self elected pastor, the Reverand Len Sparkes. Len is an collier who decided that religion was more important to him than working in the mines. As a result he retired from work to run the Mission. A sunday school, an weekly evening club for children and an annual trip to the seaside are part of Mission life. At one time the village supported two or three chapels, which are now demolished.
